questionList.questionStatement: Behavior that is repeated on a daily basis is referred to as:

Which one of the following cellular forms did Robert Hooke observe under his crude microscope?
Which of the following is a distinguishing feature of amino acids that is NOT found in carbohydrates?
What is the branch of biology that studies about the origin and gradual changes of living things?

What is the general term for the part of the protoplasm that lies outside the nucleus?
While conducting research, which of the following should a biologist do first?
Choose the organisms that belongs to the eukaryotes?
Which of the following statements is true about matter and energy in the ecosystem?
questionList.choiceA: Both matter and energy are recycled
questionList.choiceB: Matter is NOT recycled; energy is recycled
questionList.choiceC: Matter is recycled; energy is NOT recycled
questionList.choiceD: Energy is recycled more than matter does

questionList.questionStatement: Which Of the following is true about protozoa?
questionList.choiceA: They are a group of bacteria
questionList.choiceC: They represent both plants and animals

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following parts of plant roots is harbouring nitrogen fixing bacteria?

Which of the following structures is NOT present in animal cells?

How many carbon and oxygen atoms are there in a molecule of maltose?
Which of the following groups of animals have males with ZZ and females with ZW sex chromosome constitution?
Which of the following carbohydrates has structural function?
During the Krebs cycle, which of the following molecules temporarily stores most of the energy released from food molecule?
Which of the following forms of nitrogen is readily utilizable by green plants?
At which stage is most of the ATP generated in aerobic respiration?
Which of the following techniques is used to separate DNA fragments according to their size on a gel?
In a cross between round green pea of RRyy genotype and wrinkled yellow pea of rrYY genotype, what is the expected genotype of F1?
Which of the following cellular structures is possessed by all cells?

Which of the following is the common characteristics of all enzymes?

Which of the following PH values represents the strongest base?
Which of the following is an accurate representation of the relationships between the terms metabolism, anabolism and catabolism?
What is the ultimate source of energy for all organisms living on the earth?
Which of the following can be taken as case for evidence of evolution from the field of plant and animal breeding?
questionList.choiceA: Artificial breeding always creates new species
questionList.choiceB: Artificial breeding only produces new organisms with higher yield
questionList.choiceC: Artificial breeding shows that natural Selection can produce variations .
questionList.choiceD: Artificial breeding can produce new variations in organisms

questionList.questionStatement: In which of the activities of the honey bee colony are worker bees involved?
Choose the characteristics that viruses share with living things.
questionList.choiceA: They are made up of many specialized cells

questionList.questionStatement: According to Lamarck's theory of evolution, what is the mechanism by which evolving organisms acquire new structures?
questionList.choiceC: Use - and - disuse of parts of the body

questionList.questionStatement: Where exactly in the cell does the Krebs cycle take place?

In Ethiopia, which one of the following Vertebrate groups has largest number of genera?
Which of the following is more true about the male of the honey bee?
For a biological detergent to effectively remove oily and greasy dirt, which of the following enzymes should it contain?
In which of the following ways is the carbon dioxide of the atmosphere fixed into the carbon found in organic molecules?
questionList.choiceA: In the breathing processes of all animals
questionList.choiceB: In the decomposition of organic molecules
questionList.choiceC: In the process of photosynthesis by green plants
questionList.choiceD: In all the cellular respiration processes of organisms

questionList.questionStatement: Which molecules carry the instructions for protein synthesis?

During protein synthesis, where in the cell does transcription take place?
In protein synthesis, what is produced during transcription?
Which of the following is true about saturated fatty acids?
questionList.choiceA: They have single bonds between carbon atoms
questionList.choiceB: They are the same as polyunsaturated fatty acids
questionList.choiceC: They are the same as monounsaturated fatty acids
questionList.choiceD: They have double bonds between the carbon atoms

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is prevented from taking place if populations are separated by a geographic barrier?

Which one of the following characteristics is UNNECESSARY for an object to be considered living thing?
What is a perfect flower?
questionList.choiceA: A flower with petals and pistil
questionList.choiceB: A flower with stamens and sepals
questionList.choiceC: A flower with stamens and pistil
questionList.choiceD: A flower with sepals and petals

questionList.questionStatement: Which term describes the process by which water is lost by evaporating through the stomata of leaves?

Which field studies the way in which individual traits of organisms are transmitted from one generation to the next?
If a cell fails to clear its cellular debris, which one of its organelles is most likely NOT functioning?
What do you call structures that have the same evolutionary origin but now are different in structure or have different functions?
Which region of the human digestive tract contains enzymes that perform well at low pH?

Which of the following pairs of individuals have identical DNA fingerprints?
Suppose a. hypothetical cube-shaped cell has sides of 10 micrometers, what is the surface area to volume ratio of this cell?
Which of the following types of chromosome mutations gives rise to an extra chromosome?
Suppose sites A, B, C and D have Simpson's Index of Diversity (d). values of 20, 8, 16 and 3, respectively, which site in dominated by one or just a few species?
Which of the following groups of plants carry out light dependent and light independent reactions of photosynthesis separate cells?
Which of the following can create strong inter-species completion if shared by two or more species?
Among the following, which one has little or no contribution the loss of biodiversity?
Which stage in the life cycle of HIV is inhibited by anti retro viral drug known as integrase-inhibitor?
questionList.choiceA: Conversion of viral RNA to DNA
questionList.choiceC: Insertion of the viral genome into host genome
questionList.choiceD: Release of the viral progeny from the cell

How are unSaturated fats distinguished?
questionList.choiceA: They are made up of glucose and fructose
questionList.choiceB: They are made up of amino acids and glycerol
questionList.choiceC: have double bonds in their carbon chains
questionList.choiceD: They have only single bonds at the points of attachment

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following pairs are analogous structures?
questionList.choiceA: Wing of a bird and wing of a butterfly
questionList.choiceB: Front leg of a horse and a human arm
questionList.choiceC: Wing of a bird and wing of a bat
questionList.choiceD: FrOnt leg of a frog and Wing of a bat

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following mating produces children all having the Same ABO blood phenotypes?
In Which of the following Solutions does an animal cell undergohaemolysis?
questionList.choiceD: In both hypotopic and hypertonic solutions

questionList.questionStatement: On which of the following does the rate of algal, photosynthesis in a lake depend?
questionList.choiceA: The oxygen content of the water
questionList.choiceB: The nitrogen content of the water
questionList.choiceC: The elevation where the lake is found
questionList.choiceD: The amount of the penetrates the lake water

questionList.choiceA: AIDS is the virus and HIV is the disease
questionList.choiceB: Both AIDS and HIV refer to the disease
questionList.choiceC: AIDS is the disease and HIV is the virus
questionList.choiceD: Both AIDS and HIV refer to the virus

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the structural similarities observed between the flippers of whales and the arms of humans?
questionList.choiceA: The human species began life in the ocean
questionList.choiceB: The human species and whales share a common ancestry
questionList.choiceC: Whales are older than the human species
questionList.choiceD: Whales have evolved from early humans that went back to the ocean

questionList.questionStatement: Suppose in an experiment conducted to test a new drug, 20 people were given the drug and 20 people a placebo. What is the control of the experiment?
questionList.choiceB: People who received the new drug
questionList.choiceD: The new drug and the placebo

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following will happen if a plant cell is kept in a solution that is stronger than its protoplasm?
questionList.choiceD: The cell will swell and burst

questionList.questionStatement: What does the absence of chloroplasts in a unicellular organism indicate?

From which organism is the first antibiotic used in medicine produced?
Which of the following did the early heterotrophs do that probably assisted the origin of autotrophs?
questionList.choiceA: They added oxygen and chlorophyll to the environment
questionList.choiceB: They added carbon dioxide to the environment
questionList.choiceC: They stored energy in the bonds of inorganic compounds
questionList.choiceD: They manufactured food from carbon dioxide and oxygen
